title: Lesson 46
paragraph: This lesson focuses on justice and lawfulness, covering fairness, legality, and enforcement.

words.example: Judges must maintain impartiality in court.

words.meaning: the theory or philosophy of law
fairness or justice in the way people are treated
words.example: The new policy ensured equity for all employees.

words.meaning: punishment inflicted as vengeance for a wrong
words.example: The criminal faced retribution for his crimes.

words.meaning: the action of discouraging criminal behavior through fear of punishment
words.example: Strict laws act as deterrence to crime.

words.meaning: lawfulness or authority according to rules
words.example: The government’s legitimacy was questioned after the scandal.
The evidence led to his vindication.

words.meaning: an official pardon for people convicted of offenses
words.example: The government granted amnesty to political prisoners.

words.meaning: settlement of a dispute by an impartial third party
words.example: The labor dispute was resolved through arbitration.

words.meaning: a body established to settle certain types of disputes
words.example: The tribunal ruled in favor of the plaintiff.
